description: An empty plastic hull from a .38 tround.

.38 Tround ammunition with 130gr FMJ bullets.  The .38 Tround was an experiment in the early 60s to try and minimize unused space in a gun's magazine. It saw a lot of production, but the guns that use it didn't. Even among Trounds, its long abandoned as not worth it, shelved in favor of the .22 and .44 Trounds.
.38 Tround Terra Drill ammuniton. A strangely shaped (even for a tround) piece of ammunition that ends in a drill bit. This feels wrong in so many ways.
